author: Giovanni Legorano
title: Italian President Starts Difficult Talks With Parties on New Government
text:
ROME—Italian President Sergio Mattarella kicked off formal consultations with Italy’s main parties to form a new government, a prospect that appeared difficult with party leaders still far from an agreement that could yield a workable coalition.
Mr. Mattarella began meeting with leaders of the parties on Wednesday, a month after national elections produced a parliament divided roughly into three rumps, with no group having won enough votes to govern alone. As a result, it could still take some weeks before Mr. Mattarella asks...
